comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Thoroughbred Horse Racing, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 14170629@N08
comment._content:
Iron Mask was a 1908 dark bay gelding sired by Disguise, out of the imported mare Royal Rose (sired by Royal Hampton).  He was bred & owned by James R. Keene.  The horse died in 1916.

The photo is most likely from 1910, when he ran in prominent New York races for two-year-olds.  Due to a wagering ban, there was no organized racing in the Northeast from late 1910 -  early 1913.

The jockey is Roscoe Troxler, who won the 1906 Kentucky Derby on Sir Huon.

comment.author: 14170629@N08
comment._content: Assuming this photo was taken the same day as the other Belmont photos posted, it would be dated later than I thought....the age of a horse in another photo sets them between 1913 - 1915.
